intro: Erophila ambigens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf watercress, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other mustard family plants. The plant has small, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and slightly succulent, adapted to thrive in moist environments. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round pods that contain seeds. Erophila ambigens is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and streams.
